data.quote: I think having toured the world and seeing many places, I've just been blown away by how we've really scarred our home. I'm as guilty as the next person if not more so. I travel a lot. The damage we do to our planet is huge.
data.author: James Blunt

data.quote: I'm always ready for the enemy to come over the hill. I'm packed and set to go. That comes from my time in the army. I used to travel in a tank, but now it's a tour bus going to safer places.
data.author: James Blunt

data.quote: Not everything in old age is grim. I haven't walked through an airport for years, and wheelchairs are the way to travel.
data.author: Donald Hall

data.quote: I'm vegan on home base, but when I travel to other countries, I throw it all into the garbage.
data.author: Lake Bell

data.quote: I think part of what I love about being an actor is getting to take on different worlds and investigate different genres and travel to different lands.
data.author: Lake Bell

data.quote: I've always been a big fan of time travel, and I'm very into the notion that some day we'll be able to do it. Beam me up!
data.author: Scott Bakula

data.quote: I hope that I'll be hot for a long time so I can make a lot of money, I can retire early, and just travel. Hopefully that will happen.
data.author: Kristin Cavallari

data.quote: I live in Chicago, but my work is always in New York or L.A., so I always have to travel for my job.
data.author: Kristin Cavallari

data.quote: I love the idea that if you're going to travel through time, you do it in this insanely dangerous car travelling at 88 miles per hour.
data.author: Ryan North

data.quote: I was destined to work with dying patients. I had no choice when I encountered my first AIDS patient. I felt called to travel some 250,000 miles each year to hold workshops that helped people cope with the most painful aspects of life, death and the transition between the two.
data.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

data.quote: Horror movies travel pretty well anyway. They're like action movies: People overseas can watch them and enjoy them, and they're not so culturally specific in terms of their references, and they can follow a good scary story.
data.author: Robert Englund

data.quote: Death by plane crash scares me. I travel a lot, and when you hit turbulence, and post 9/11, that's in the back of my mind a bit.
data.author: Robert Englund

data.quote: Even with protection, even with death threats, I can publish, I can travel and I can live the life that I want and not the one my parents want or some imam somewhere thinks I should live.
data.author: Ayaan Hirsi Ali

data.quote: I always want to give my best and do the best I can. I know when I have sung my best and when I haven't. There can be stresses and hassles with time travel and press attention. I just have to adapt and find a way of dealing with it.
data.author: Katherine Jenkins

data.quote: In Heaven, I believe my dad is somewhere doing something nice. I feel I've been too lucky to travel this far without somebody guiding me.
data.author: Katherine Jenkins

data.quote: It's shocking to think about how little the travel industry cares about sustainability - and it's the basis of their business!
data.author: Jochen Zeitz

data.quote: We may regard the solar systems as separate sponges, swimming in a World of Divine Spirit, and thus it will be apparent that in order to travel from one solar system to another, it would be necessary to be able to function consciously in the highest vehicle of man, the Divine Spirit.
data.author: Max Heindel

data.quote: I think all regions have had their peculiarities of speech rounded off by television, radio, and people travel so much more now.
data.author: Daniel Woodrell

data.quote: All the rappers my age are getting Audemars and Rolexes. I want to find my own thing. That's why I travel the world - for me, that's my B-side, why we go places. I have a Hublot on from time to time but I want a home base watch - something that's elegant but has got a little pizzazz to it.
data.author: Wale

data.quote: My first experiences of Colorado travel have been rather severe. At Greeley, I got a small upstairs room at first, but gave it up to a married couple with a child, and then had one downstairs no bigger than a cabin, with only a canvas partition. It was very hot, and every place was thick with black flies.
data.author: Isabella Bird

data.quote: I particularly like to travel for work because you see a completely different side of the country you're visiting.
data.author: Philip Treacy

data.quote: The growth of purposeful travel is a good thing. It can have a positive impact. We should continue to experiment and move along this line.
data.author: Joe Garcia

data.quote: Travel is an exercise partly in broadening yourself and partly in defining your own limits.
data.author: Andrew Solomon

data.quote: I started traveling out of curiosity, but I have come to believe in travel's political importance, that encouraging a nation's citizenry to travel may be as important as encouraging school attendance, environmental conservation, or national thrift. You cannot understand the otherness of places you have not encountered.
data.author: Andrew Solomon

data.quote: You can't expect the entire world to come to New York to see you. You have to travel to them.
data.author: Theodore Bikel

data.quote: I realized I couldn't have one foot in the fiction world and one foot in the nonfiction world, which is why 'Here I Go Again' is so not me. I didn't graduate from high school in the '90s, I never listened to metal music, and I don't time travel.
data.author: Jen Lancaster

data.quote: Michael Palin decided to give up on his considerable comedy talents to make those dreadfully tedious travel shows. Have you ever tried to watch one?
data.author: John Cleese

data.quote: Touring can be tough; the crew and I travel everywhere by a big pink bus, and live in petrol stations.
data.author: Marina and the Diamonds

data.quote: I'm a 'tweener,' man! I couldn't march with Dr. King and them. And I'm too old to be a hip-hopper. But I've been granted honorary status in each generation... I see my tongue as a bridge over which ideas can travel back and forth.
data.author: Michael Eric Dyson

data.quote: Big climbs energize me. It's all the other aspects of being a pro-climber that wear me down. The travel and expeditions and training can become pretty tiring. But the actual big climbs - that's what I live for.
data.author: Alex Honnold

data.quote: I travel around and hear from so many kids. Their parents say they were always very picky but they watch the show and they want to try stuff. The show is entertainment, but I think it has done so much for the public perception of what food can be.
data.author: Tom Colicchio

data.quote: Since I travel so much, it's always great to be home. There's nothing like getting to raid my own refrigerator at two in the morning.
data.author: Amy Grant

data.quote: Being in the pop group Eternal gave me the most wonderful opportunity to travel the world, and I have visited some spectacular countries.
data.author: Louise Nurding

data.quote: The genre has moved into this commercial aspect of itself, and ignored this extraordinarily rich literature that's filed everywhere else except under travel.
data.author: Robyn Davidson

data.quote: The truth is I'm not really interested in travel writing as it's generally conceived, and even less so in female travel writing.
data.author: Robyn Davidson

data.quote: Every congresswoman surely endures the same strains that drive some of her male colleagues to have affairs: lots of travel, families far away, heady work that makes a domestic routine seem distant and boring. But the stakes are much higher for women, because they are still judged by a different standard.
data.author: Hanna Rosin

data.quote: Once you're in a room like '30 Rock,' it's a creative setting, so you write more even after you go home, just because you're still in that mode of coming up with jokes. So the job wasn't sapping standup jokes, but it was sapping stand up time and energy, and I wouldn't be able to travel as much.
data.author: Hannibal Buress

data.quote: I think that you certainly don't have to be aged and travel the world to write a poem.
data.author: Rita Dove

data.quote: In a certain sense, a writer is an exile, an outsider, always reporting on things, and it is part of his life to keep on the move. Travel is natural.
data.author: James Salter

data.quote: I love anywhere new and different. That's the fun of travel. I've always loved driving through Spain, France and Italy - sometimes in an Alfa Spider.
data.author: Rory Bremner

data.quote: I've always traveled, as a kid my parents moved me around, a different place in Germany every four years. But I got the travel bug when I was a kid, living in different countries.
data.author: Dominic Monaghan

data.quote: I've been fortunate enough to write a book and travel the country to sign and sell it, so I can safely say that a five-second burst of conversation while you're scribbling your name, over and over, is not the most reliable way to bond with Americans.
data.author: Gwen Ifill

data.quote: I hate to travel. I don't go anywhere.
data.author: Ingmar Bergman

data.quote: The idea of making access to safe abortions harder and more expensive and more difficult, having to travel across state lines - that puts women's health and lives in jeopardy, which is something I think no one wants.
data.author: Cynthia Nixon

data.quote: The Nike Fuel Band is interesting - it measures your movements and how far you've walked and how hard you've worked that day. I prefer using when I travel. It's a fun way to see how far I've walked - how many steps I've taken when I'm walking around different cities.
data.author: Andrew Luck

data.quote: I travel a lot, and that makes it harder to date, but it also opens up opportunities for me to meet people where I wouldn't normally meet them.
data.author: Cameron Dallas

data.quote: I travel fairly lightly because you have to these days. I always take a laptop and an iPod so I can watch movies and listen to music. And my Gameboy. That's a good time-killer.
data.author: Bill Engvall

data.quote: In my 20s, as I began to travel in Europe, I found comfort in religious paintings. Even though my own belief in Catholic dogma had been shaken and weakened, I found that the beauty and the richness of the art still held me.
data.author: Colm Toibin

data.quote: Eating well was something I learned as I started to be successful and had to travel and perform concerts, which are an intense cardio workout.
data.author: Curtis Jackson

data.quote: Because travel has always been such a vital part of myself and so essential to who I am, I have made the decision to continue to put myself back out into the world. And that's not an easy decision to make.
data.author: Amanda Lindhout

data.quote: Getting on a plane is hard for me, but I do it, because travel is vital to me.
data.author: Amanda Lindhout

data.quote: I don't like to travel. Yet all my books seem to involve a journey.
data.author: Chris Van Allsburg

data.quote: The railroads needed standardized time; as a result, the technology of train travel shaped the way everyone gets up, eats, goes to sleep, calculates age, and, perhaps of no small importance, imagine the world as a whole, ticking reliably, with reliable deviations, according to the beat of one central clock in a physical location.
data.author: Stacey D'Erasmo

data.quote: As a child I sometimes used to travel to the West Bank to visit my family, so I know what the checkpoints felt like. I knew what it was like to live under occupation.
data.author: Queen Rania of Jordan

data.quote: I try to travel as light as possible to avoid baggage issues. Los Angeles airport is notorious for baggage delays, so I'll often FedEx a suitcase ahead or back so I don't need to stand around; it also minimises problems at check-in.
data.author: Kyle MacLachlan

data.quote: You don't have to travel, but I find extended travel to be a helpful tool for reexamining yourself and the constraints you've artificially placed on your life. It's easy to believe everything has to be done one way if you're always in one place around the same people.
data.author: Timothy Ferriss

data.quote: I knew from the first moment I picked up a camera, on my first school assignment, what I wanted to do for the rest of my life. I was going to find a way to travel the world and tell the stories of the people I met through photographs.
data.author: Mary Ellen Mark

data.quote: During prom season, I travel around the country with a 20-by-24 camera - which is logistically complicated - and photograph proms. My husband made a film of it.
data.author: Mary Ellen Mark

data.quote: When I travel with my kids abroad, I am not myself, but I'm more a father who wants to protect them. Sometimes, I am even aggressive about certain things and get surprised seeing myself like that: for instance, when people want to take pictures of them. I am fine if they want to take my pictures, but they are not public property.
data.author: A. R. Rahman

data.quote: Being able to travel the world is pretty cool. There are places that I've always wanted to go to but being able to go there as somebody who's a musician and is recognised as one is cool.
data.author: Tinie Tempah

data.quote: Travel books are, by and large, boring. They lodge uncomfortably between fact, fiction and autobiography.
data.author: Arthur Smith

data.quote: Occasionally I find a travel book that is both illuminating and entertaining, where vivid writing and research replace self-indulgence and sloppy prose.
data.author: Arthur Smith

data.quote: Don Quixote's 'Delusions' is an excellent read - far better than my own forthcoming travel book, 'Walking Backwards Across Tuscany.'
data.author: Arthur Smith

data.quote: Scoring goals is the best feeling you can have. I always look up at the stand for my family straight afterwards it means everything to me that they travel to every game.
data.author: Frank Lampard

data.quote: There are always things I find difficult - being in crowds, remembering faces. I do like routines. I always travel with someone. My life in Avignon is a very quiet one. I have an apartment that looks over the whole city. I can drop into town, but a lot of the time I write from home. In some respects I still live a very quiet, simple life.
data.author: Daniel Tammet

data.quote: In the spring of 1968, The Beatles and I were invited by Maharishi Mahesh Yogi to travel to Riskikesh, India. Riskikesh has been an important spiritual place to many millions of people over the years. It is situated where the Ganges River flows out of the Himalayas, and to be in that atmosphere was something incredibly special.
data.author: Mike Love

data.quote: With all the stuff that's going on in the world - after I watch the news, read the news, and listen to my podcasts, at the end of the day, am I really going to watch an episode of murder and time travel?
data.author: Betty Gilpin

data.quote: I certainly have routines in my day-to-day life that are important to me and still give me feelings of security and control, but the capacity to break out of them every so often as I travel has given me a second wind.
data.author: Daniel Tammet

data.quote: Nobody controls me. I travel with my husband when I can, when I know that I can go, and I know that my son is okay alone for a few days with the help.
data.author: Melania Trump

data.quote: Those are the kinds of roles you can really sink your teeth into. Characters with an edge. When you're playing someone who's sort of seedy, there's less limitation, there's so much space you can travel. There's room to move in.
data.author: Matt Dillon

data.quote: We take so many of our freedoms for granted nowadays - I can travel where I like, I can have a baby when I like, I can do any job I want - but I do think chivalry has been lost a little bit.
data.author: Dan Stevens

data.quote: 'What comes next?' is the constant question I'm asked by outsiders eager to travel to the island. During the eleven years I traveled to Havana, very few Cubans I met on the island ever bothered to verbalize this question.
data.author: Brin-Jonathan Butler

data.quote: For years, I had no time for exploratory travel.
data.author: Renee Fleming

data.quote: Having to travel so much plays havoc with your personal life.
data.author: Renee Fleming

data.quote: I am always exhausted; I am always trying to find more time to be with my family, which is why they travel with me so much.
data.author: John Tesh

data.quote: Everyone carries his own inch rule of taste, and amuses himself by applying it, triumphantly, wherever he travels.
data.author: Henry Adams

data.quote: I hate to travel with stuff.
data.author: Manolo Blahnik

data.quote: I've always been into visual effects. It was something I took keen interest in before films happened. Ironically, I am a part of 'Raaz 3,' a film that is shot entirely on 3D. It has encouraged me to pursue my dream. Hopefully, if time permits, I will travel to the United States and attend a crash course in visual graphics and animation.
data.author: Emraan Hashmi

data.quote: I live in a Moomin house in East London which I fill with blankets and nice crockery and get people round for dinner. When you travel a lot, you feel rootless and adrift - this is my sanctuary, where I can breathe out.
data.author: Bat for Lashes

data.quote: If you play the same club every week of every month, it's kind of boring. It's great that you can play one night in Brazil and one night in Japan, one night in Europe, and see the world. It's amazing what you see if you travel around the world.
data.author: Tiesto

data.quote: You must know that Iran has a great number of productions. Many films are released. Most of them, like in the rest of the world, are commercial and shallow films. These are the most popular ones. And there are a few ones that actually develop more profound and thoughtful aspects of life. Only some of these films travel out of Iran.
data.author: Asghar Farhadi

data.quote: I like playing tennis. I've always enjoyed the process of being a tennis player; I'm just not sure that I enjoyed the travel at the end, and my body didn't recover from the day-to-day grind.
data.author: Andy Roddick

data.quote: It's a very immersive and intense form of travel to walk around with an interpreter and stop random people on the street and ask them about their lives.
data.author: Brandon Stanton

data.quote: We all become great explorers during our first few days in a new city, or a new love affair.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: I never travel without my Stetson, but the more I wear it the more I realise that no one wears hats any more. When I was a kid everybody wore hats, especially in Texas, but I get off the plane in Dallas now and I'm the only guy with a hat. It's amazing.
data.author: Larry Hagman

data.quote: Touch seems to be such an important tool for enhancing social cooperation and affiliation that we have evolved a special physical route along which those subliminal feelings of social connection travel from skin to brain.
data.author: Leonard Mlodinow

data.quote: My father's plan was, we were going to grow up and travel the world.
data.author: Philippe Cousteau, Jr.

data.quote: I travel all over the country speaking to young people, and I am always amazed at how engaged in environmental conservation they are.
data.author: Philippe Cousteau, Jr.

data.quote: I've said before, the number one thing that we have to work on is protecting the gay community from sharia law. Now, in the United States, it's probably not a big issue right now, but my brother-in-law is gay, and his partner and I would like them to be able to travel any place in the world without them risking harm.
data.author: Foster Friess

data.quote: I want my life to match my work now. I don't want to work and then travel. I want to be at one place.
data.author: Sarita Choudhury

data.quote: Our career is a dream. I mean, we get to act, travel around the world, and meet cool people. What's not to love!
data.author: Mary-Kate Olsen

data.quote: Doing Shakespeare once is not fair to the play. I have been in Shakespeare plays when it's not until the last two or three performances when I even understand certain things. In the old days star actors would travel the world doing the same parts over and over again.
data.author: Al Pacino

data.quote: Chess has given me a lot more than I could ask for. I have been able to feel special, travel the world and do what I truly enjoy. Moreover, chess players love being their own boss and hate having to wake up early!
data.author: Viswanathan Anand

data.quote: The good news is that real-world hands-on conservation is alive and well and catching on across the America I travel.
data.author: Ted Nugent

data.quote: When I travel abroad, because I'm Columbian, I'm always one that they check twice and security and I'm the one that they open my bag and the one they pull to the side to check the visa.
data.author: Sofia Vergara

data.quote: I remember returning to Bangalore after a few months of travel and seeing it as a first-world city, like New York or San Francisco. This may be obvious to some people, but I grew up in Delhi, and I had no experience of how someone from a 'Tier 2' city may view a 'Tier 1' city. You really do emigrate between worlds when you come from those towns.
data.author: Karan Mahajan

data.quote: I've been lucky enough to travel widely. When you're based in Europe, it's very easy to go to Madrid or Budapest for the weekend. I also lived in Italy for ten years and now live in Ireland.
data.author: Laurie Graham

data.quote: If you travel 11 months a year - from one dangerous or isolated situation to the next - if you live in hotels, and every relationship with another human being is a two-week relationship, the only other people who have any idea what you're going through or how strung out you are are other photographers.
data.author: Rick Smolan

data.quote: I find Facebook absolutely fascinating because I don't think there's ever been any one source that had so much information about each of us - who we talk to, who our friends are, what books we read, what we're buying, what movies we saw, what our travel is.
data.author: Rick Smolan

data.quote: I have just returned from Boston. It is the only thing to do if you find yourself up there.
data.author: Fred Allen

data.quote: In the Arctic, the Inuit are saying water and land are the same; they're an unbroken unity. In the winter, you travel on the ice because it's the linkage and the easiest way, and in the summer, you move around on the water.
data.author: John Ralston Saul

data.quote: Novels set in distant places give us expectations not unlike those we have of travel writing, and often the distinctions are blurred, as in, say, the way the low life of Tokyo's Shinjuku Ward is depicted in John David Morley's recent 'Pictures from the Water Trade.'
data.author: Darryl Pinckney

data.quote: I love short trips to New York to me it is the finest three-day town on earth.
data.author: James Cameron

data.quote: No matter where I've been overseas, the food stinks, except in Italy.
data.author: Carmen Electra

data.quote: Traveling is seeing it is the implicit that we travel by.
data.author: Cynthia Ozick

data.quote: I'm a travel enthusiast.
data.author: Iggy Pop

data.quote: I like to travel in jeans because I don't want to wallow around in my suit, you know? They cost too much. Jeans are comfortable.
data.author: Louie Gohmert

data.quote: It really is a fact that liberals are much higher than conservatives on a major personality trait called 'openness to experience.' People who are high on openness to experience just crave novelty, variety, diversity, new ideas, travel. People low on it like things that are familiar, that are safe and dependable.
data.author: Jonathan Haidt

data.quote: I did rebel. I was the rebel in my family, because my dad wanted me to go and just travel with him.
data.author: Dhani Harrison

data.quote: A man who leaves home to mend himself and others is a philosopher; but he who goes from country to country, guided by the blind impulse of curiosity, is a vagabond.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: I'd rather have huge success and huge failures than travel in the middle of the road.
data.author: Kevyn Aucoin

data.quote: Every time I took a long leave from home, I felt as if I were going to conquer the world. Or rather, take possession of what is my birthright, my inheritance.
data.author: Ella Maillart

data.quote: In America there are two classes of travel - first class, and with children.
data.author: Robert Benchley

data.quote: I want to travel around the country and make my living playing music. I also try to behave in a way that I would appreciate as a music fan. That's how we conduct ourselves, be it in writing music or playing it live.
data.author: Buzz Osborne

data.quote: You become a better writer by writing. You become a better travel writer by writing about travel.
data.author: Tim Cahill

data.quote: When I travel I normally eat club sandwiches or I bring my own food. When you go into a new town, it's very had to find a good place to eat.
data.author: Paul Prudhomme

data.quote: My writing is a combination of three elements. The first is travel: not travel like a tourist, but travel as exploration. The second is reading literature on the subject. The third is reflection.
data.author: Ryszard Kapuscinski

data.quote: The perfect pop song is a 20th-century creation; it's not a sonnet, it's not an opera, it's something short - three and a half minutes by nature - and has this ability to travel and to defy class and economic structures.
data.author: Doug Aitken

data.quote: Actually, I started to become an actress because I met someone who was just a friend and I found his life wonderful, I thought, Oh my god, you can travel, you're free, you can do what you want, you're the boss. And then I met an actor and I was in love with him.
data.author: Lea Seydoux

data.quote: Whether a plane to Singapore, a subway in Manhattan, or the streets of Cincinnati, I search for meaningful conversation wherever I may travel. Without it, I believe we lose the ability to not only understand others, but more importantly, ourselves.
data.author: Dhani Jones

data.quote: Every day is intense and alive, whether it's travel, work, even down time, which there is so little of.
data.author: Josh Lucas

data.quote: The worst thing about touring is the travel.
data.author: Kerry King

data.quote: When I was little, I didn't really travel - from the suburbs to Paris was already a journey. I had a foreigner's eye on the city, and I still enjoy that point of view. Then there's the fact that one of the things that touches me most is injustice.
data.author: JR

data.quote: I always thought when I hit 50 years old that'd be it for the travel. I don't have to tell you - you wait at an airport, your flight's delayed, get on a 14-hour flight, get off, get stuck in traffic, you get to the hotel and the room service is closed.
data.author: Brian Setzer

data.quote: To get away from one's working environment is, in a sense, to get away from one's self; and this is often the chief advantage of travel and change.
data.author: Charles Horton Cooley

data.quote: Greater personal choice, individually tailored services, stronger local accountability, greater efficiency - these are all central to the new direction of travel we have set for our public services.
data.author: John Hutton

data.quote: Movie acting is a great job for your twenties: You travel all over, you have affairs with people, and you throw yourself into one part and then another. It gets more challenging as you get older, and it's not just having a daughter, it's wanting to have your own life and be yourself.
data.author: Helen Hunt

data.quote: The only thing I like about air travel is it gives me time to read.
data.author: Jane Lindskold

data.quote: Rail travel for me is the most relaxing, most scenic way to see the country.
data.author: John Paul DeJoria

data.quote: I wanted to do my part to help preserve that golden age of travel... I step aboard The Patron Tequila Express railcar, and I go back in time to the days when a long journey was something fun and very special.
data.author: John Paul DeJoria

data.quote: I've always enjoyed traveling and having experience with different cultures and different people. But it's also a wonderful thing to be able to benefit and enable research, not only in our country but around the world.
data.author: Laurel Clark

data.quote: I'm passionate and I travel the world not just as a tourist but to understand cultures... I've lived with Masai tribe... I travel the world and bring it back in the form of a research book that would become the starting point for the collection.
data.author: John Galliano

data.quote: I travel a lot, but I don't come away with new inspiration.
data.author: Edward Ruscha

data.quote: As an actor, I travel around a lot and live in a lot of hotels, and many times I've been in a town where the only entertainment to be had is what you find in the hotel bar or lobby.
data.author: Beau Bridges

data.quote: You discover how confounding the world is when you try to draw it. You look at a car, and you try to see its car-ness, and you're like an immigrant to your own world. You don't have to travel to encounter weirdness. You wake up to it.
data.author: Shaun Tan

data.quote: But I want people to understand that poker's not all glamorous, it's not all being on TV and making tons of money. It's a hard life. It's a lot of travel. It's a lot of weird hours.
data.author: Chris Moneymaker

data.quote: I mean, the first 'Back to the Future' is kind of a perfect script, I think, in terms of handling time travel the best. It depends on your definition. To me, that means it effectively uses it in the story.
data.author: Rian Johnson

data.quote: My parents and my grandfather on my mom's side would travel the earth. They went to Australia and China, and they went to probably every soccer game I ever played.
data.author: Brandi Chastain

data.quote: I still don't have a car. I still travel by public transport. I take autos to travel to and fro for recordings.
data.author: Arijit Singh

data.quote: For years, I had a top secret clearance and never left Russia. Just once did I go to Bulgaria with my wife for a holiday at the Golden Sands resort, but I could not mention my real name. I was allowed to travel abroad only in the early 1990s.
data.author: Mikhail Kalashnikov

data.quote: When Bangladesh refused to renew my passport, I used U.N. travel documents. You can't disown your country.
data.author: Taslima Nasrin

data.quote: Then I was lucky I met with my future husband, and I started new life with my husband, and I was happy again. He was a musician. I start to travel with him through Europe also and around the former Soviet Union.
data.author: Olga Korbut

data.quote: I always travel with my guitar. I take it myself - with me in my hand. I don't like to send it by cargo because it's dangerous. There is no way I would do that.
data.author: Juanes

data.quote: The hardest part is to travel, and to be away from your family.
data.author: Glenn Tipton

data.quote: My wife and I have so much fun when we travel and find anything... like stray cats and squirrels.
data.author: Eric Roberts

data.quote: Travel is very subjective. What one person loves, another loathes.
data.author: Robin Leach

data.quote: I don't think I could have a genuine relationship with someone who didn't love to travel and appreciate new foods. Traveling is a big part of my life, and I want to share that with the people close to me.
data.author: Candice Accola

data.quote: For the Trump brand name, when we build, we want only the best buildings in the world. We travel a lot to see real estate projects worldwide, and we always study what can be done better. There's no question about it: a Trump Tower has to have the very best quality, amenities and facilities. People want that ultra-luxurious lifestyle.
data.author: Eric Trump

data.quote: One of the perks of my job as a fashion journalist is the travel opportunity.
data.author: Derek Blasberg

data.quote: I want to explore a new place each year, and it can be within India. When I was shooting for 'Mohenjo Daro', I couldn't travel out of the country for two years. But it gave me an opportunity to explore new places within India. I'm sure there are so many places to explore in India, and I would love to go there.
data.author: Pooja Hegde

data.quote: On reflection, I am always pleasantly surprised when ordinary members of the public stop me in the street to say, 'Thank you,' I guess for making travel and other goods and services affordable to them.
data.author: Stelios Haji-Ioannou

data.quote: I was born to travel and write verse.
data.author: Theophile Gautier

data.quote: Travel is the best and probably cheapest graduate school you can buy.
data.author: Tom Freston

data.quote: Singing is my passion and I always wanted to travel the country.
data.author: Thia Megia

data.quote: Travel is the frivolous part of serious lives, and the serious part of frivolous ones.
data.author: Sophie Swetchine

data.quote: I say that I get paid to travel, and I play the shows for free.
data.author: Tyler Farr

data.quote: I like the opportunity to travel the world and work in close company with other people.
data.author: Marc Garneau

data.quote: On long haul flights I always drink loads and loads of water and eat light and healthy food.
data.author: Lisa Snowdon

data.quote: As many of you know I travel a good bit and do not get to see my friends and family as much as I would like.
data.author: Natalie Gulbis

data.quote: Sometimes you just want to get away and be normal for a few days. It's a treat to travel without your racket bag.
data.author: Eugenie Bouchard

data.quote: The time to enjoy a European trip is about three weeks after unpacking.
data.author: George Ade

data.quote: High-speed rail would revolutionise interstate travel and would also be an economic game-changer for dozens of regional communities along its path.
data.author: Anthony Albanese

data.quote: I myself believe that there will one day be time travel because when we find that something isn't forbidden by the over-arching laws of physics we usually eventually find a technological way of doing it.
data.author: David Deutsch

data.quote: I get pretty much all the exercise I need walking down airport concourses carrying bags.
data.author: Guy Clark

data.quote: As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract. You are today where your thoughts have brought you; you will be tomorrow where your thoughts take you.
data.author: James Lane Allen

data.quote: Normally, it takes me about three years to write one of the big books. It is usually four years between releases because of the huge amount of travel and PR and just nuisance going on around them. I have a lot of pressure from publishers and agents.
data.author: Diana Galbadon

data.quote: For young girls, whom I meet a lot when I travel around the country, it will be a big thing. It will really show them that there's no post in Denmark that a girl can't aspire to.
data.author: Helle Thorning-Schmidt

data.quote: The biggest luxury is a job in which I get to live in New York, travel the world, and work with so many incredible people.
data.author: Leigh Lezark

data.quote: I'm not a DJ, I don't know how to scratch and I don't know how to mix, but I do know how to party. One of my jobs is actually to travel the world and party.
data.author: Amber Rose

data.quote: Air travel survived decades of terrorism, including attacks which resulted in the deaths of everyone on the plane. It survived 9/11. It'll survive the next successful attack. The only real worry is that we'll scare ourselves into making air travel so onerous that we won't fly anymore.
data.author: Bruce Schneier

data.quote: I don't travel anywhere without the PS3 and XBox. There's nothing better to do on long bus trips while on tour.
data.author: Soulja Boy

data.quote: I get to travel, see the world, meet people and be independent. I feel blessed.
data.author: Bar Refaeli

data.quote: I'm a painter, really. To be successful, you have to go to Hollywood, and I didn't like to travel.
data.author: H. R. Giger

data.quote: I travel often, so my routine is always getting scrambled. But on a standard sort of day, I get up at 6, pack lunches, hustle the kids off to school, then brew a pot of coffee and head downstairs to the dungeon, as I call it: my cobwebby office in the basement.
data.author: Benjamin Percy

data.quote: For people to understand me when I travel, I speak with my hands.
data.author: Marcel Carne

data.quote: I would like to host a show, something like travel or cooking or something like that, something I'm really interested in, and so I'm pitching a couple television shows.
data.author: Trishelle Cannatella

data.quote: Since traveling is such a big part of my life when I am working, I like to vacation relatively close to home. Florida is a great place for me to go and relax. It's so close, which is perfect because it's the minimal travel time.
data.author: Hilary Rhoda

data.quote: The attention of a traveller, should be particularly turned, in the first place, to the various works of Nature, to mark the distinctions of the climates he may explore, and to offer such useful observations on the different productions as may occur.
data.author: William Bartram

data.quote: Two great talkers will not travel far together.
data.author: George Borrow

data.quote: Wherever we go, across the Pacific or Atlantic, we meet, not similarity so much as 'the bizarre'. Things astonish us, when we travel, that surprise nobody else.
data.author: Mary Ritter Beard

data.quote: The gift of sobriety is clarity and a sense of connection - and travel only enhances that.
data.author: J. Maarten Troost

data.quote: My first ever job after college was as a flight attendant. I wanted to travel and could not afford it, so I decided to get myself a job where I could travel. I did it for two years and had great fun.
data.author: Jacqueline Winspear

data.quote: I think it's important to travel around in order to get a notion of what's going on, to find out what people are think about. I enjoy talking on campuses most because people are more informed and discussion is generally livelier.
data.author: Harrison Salisbury

data.quote: All I wanted was to be big, to be in show business and to travel... and that's what I've been doing all my life.
data.author: Count Basie

data.quote: To enjoy enduring success we should travel a little in advance of the world.
data.author: John McDonald

data.quote: I served at the Pentagon and at Fort Leavenworth - my job was video cameraman, and that allowed me to travel to places like Korea, Japan, Alaska, Germany and the Netherlands.
data.author: Chad Coleman

data.quote: If you travel first class, you think first class and you are more likely to play first class.
data.author: Ray Floyd

data.quote: White sharks and tuna travel for thousands of miles before returning to the same hot spot just as salmon do when they return to the same stream. These journeys are the marine equivalent of wildebeest migrations that take place on the Serengeti plain in Africa.
data.author: Barbara Block

data.quote: All my books reflect travel adventures of some kind, and all have a soul: a spiritual or mystical underpinning.
data.author: O. R. Melling

data.quote: On the whole, when I travel to different countries, I like to find the hidden places, so I tend to avoid the cities - but in terms of the ease of getting about, finding what you need, the excitement, that undercurrent of whatever you want it to be, it's got to be London.
data.author: Will Tudor

data.quote: Airline travel is hours of boredom interrupted by moments of stark terror.
data.author: Al Boliska

data.quote: Soul travel can be a general expansion of awareness and knowingness or conscious experience of the heavenly worlds.
data.author: Bob Hayes

data.quote: A journey by Sea and Land, Five Hundred Miles, is not undertaken without money.
data.author: Lewis Hallam

data.quote: It's hard now to imagine that kind of travel and the daily tasks they simply took for granted. If a wagon axle broke, you had to stop and carve a new one. To cross a river, you sometimes had to build a raft.
data.author: James Houston

data.quote: The purpose of human life is to serve, and to show compassion and the will to help others.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: It's sad when someone you know becomes someone you knew.
data.author: Henry Rollins

data.quote: A sympathetic friend can be quite as dear as a brother.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: Flowers grow out of dark moments.
data.author: Corita Kent

data.quote: Remember me with smiles and laughter, for that is how I will remember you all. If you can only remember me with tears, then don't remember me at all.
data.author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

data.quote: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: Grief changes shape, but it never ends.
data.author: Keanu Reeves

data.quote: One might expect that the families of murder victims would be showered with sympathy and support, embraced by their communities. But in reality they are far more likely to feel isolated, fearful, and ashamed, overwhelmed by grief and guilt, angry at the criminal-justice system, and shunned by their old friends.
data.author: Eric Schlosser

data.quote: It is only after one is in trouble that one realizes how little sympathy and kindness there are in the world.
data.author: Nellie Bly

data.quote: I've always thought of acting as more of an exercise in empathy, which is not to be confused with sympathy. You're trying to get inside a certain emotional reality or motivational reality and try to figure out what that's about so you can represent it.
data.author: Edward Norton

data.quote: What is lovely never dies, But passes into other loveliness.
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: The dew of compassion is a tear.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: It is a great consolation for me to remember that the Lord, to whom I had drawn near in humble and child-like faith, has suffered and died for me, and that He will look on me in love and compassion.
data.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

data.quote: A sorrow's crown of sorrow is remembering happier times.
data.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

data.quote: Come away, O human child: To the waters and the wild with a fairy, hand in hand, For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand.
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: Our trials, our sorrows, and our grieves develop us.
data.author: Orison Swett Marden

data.quote: I say to people who care for people who are dying, if you really love that person and want to help them, be with them when their end comes close. Sit with them - you don't even have to talk. You don't have to do anything but really be there with them.
data.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

data.quote: It is foolish to tear one's hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less by baldness.
data.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

data.quote: Let no one weep for me, or celebrate my funeral with mourning; for I still live, as I pass to and fro through the mouths of men.
data.author: Quintus Ennius

data.quote: When you're successful, people have no sympathy. Nobody wants to catch the tears of a millionaire.
data.author: Boy George

data.quote: When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish; Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal.
data.author: Thomas Moore

data.quote: Truly, it is in darkness that one finds the light, so when we are in sorrow, then this light is nearest of all to us.
data.author: Meister Eckhart

data.quote: Children require guidance and sympathy far more than instruction.
data.author: Anne Sullivan

data.quote: Interest does not tie nations together it sometimes separates them. But sympathy and understanding does unite them.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: The knowledge that we have brother scouts working in the same uniform, to the same ends, in the same way, in all corners of the Empire, cannot but make scouts proud of their brotherhood, and cannot fail to bring them into closer sympathy.
data.author: Robert Baden-Powell

data.quote: Sorrow is so easy to express and yet so hard to tell.
data.author: Joni Mitchell

data.quote: Any other illness, any other disease that we're faced with, there's sympathy and understanding. We get help for those. With mental illness, our go-to is to categorize them as, 'Oh, they're crazy,' to belittle the problem.
data.author: Chris Wood

data.quote: Women ought to feel a peculiar sympathy in the colored man's wrong, for, like him, she has been accused of mental inferiority, and denied the privileges of a liberal education.
data.author: Angelina Grimke

data.quote: Any mind that is capable of real sorrow is capable of good.
data.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

data.quote: To desire and expect nothing for oneself and to have profound sympathy for others is genuine holiness.
data.author: Ivan Turgenev

data.quote: Grief knits two hearts in closer bonds than happiness ever can and common sufferings are far stronger links than common joys.
data.author: Alphonse de Lamartine

data.quote: Badges mean nothing in themselves, but they mark a certain achievement and they are a link between the rich and the poor. For when one girl sees a badge on a sister Scout's arm, if that girl has won the same badge, it at once awakens an interest and sympathy between them.
data.author: Juliette Gordon Low

data.quote: As human beings, we all have reasons for our behavior. There may be people who have certain physiological issues that dictate why they make certain choices. On the whole, though, I think we're dictated by our structure, our past, our environment, our culture. So once you understand the patterns that shape a person, how can you not find sympathy?
data.author: Forest Whitaker

data.quote: In externals we advance with lightening express speed, in modes of thought and sympathy we lumber on in stage-coach fashion.
data.author: Frances E. Willard
